alert.note: Alert for Chase (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 5:41PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Chase County through 615 PM CDT... At 540 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 14 miles south of Cottonwood Falls, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Matfield Green. This includes Interstate 35 between Mile Markers 97 and 111. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
